comment: Pretty easy class, especially since you probably know enough Spanish to understand. Most of class time is spoken ONLY in Spanish-so be ready! She was sometimes unclear with due dates and what she wanted but overall she was fun, funny and helpful.  Participate in class and you will be fine! I would take her again.

Rosana is an amazing teacher! She uses a good mix of worksheets and book work! The online activities are tedious, but that is the case with any Spanish class. She is helpful and always works with you when you don't understand. Take her!!! She is also very funny and keeps class interesting

Thought the class was going to be much tougher than it actually was. Ayala was a great help and kept the class engaged everyday. Keep up with all the hw assignments and activities and this class shouldn't be a burden. I didn't take Spanish since high school (5 years ago) and I made a B. Overall, Ayala was great and made the class very enjoyable.
Hard class, if you dont understand go to her right away or you are done for.

I loved this teacher.  She is funny, relevant and brings spanish into your world. She is very helpful when you need assistance.  She prepares you for tests ahead of time. Do your homework and ask questions and you should be fine.

Overall great teacher.  She is understanding, helpful, funny at times, and very easy as long as you put a little effort into studying.  The only negative is that she is somewhat all over the place with organization and dates.  We never quite knew exactly when our tests, quizzes, and homework was due.  I would still highly recommend her though!

She's nice,funny,and slows down when you can't catch what she's saying. Def need the textbook because we use that in class a lot and online homework. Exams are pretty easy- she tells you a heads up with an outline. Recommended

She speaks Spanish very clearly and explains everything slowly and thoroughly. I had no problem learning Spanish in her class. She is, however, quite disorganized and it's hard to keep track of what is due when. She gives second chances, too, so if you need to redo something talk to her. Very helpful and easily approachable for extra help if needed
Awsome! Very laid back; embodies the latin mentality. I recommend her. She is not meticulous and she is just here to teach and does it in a way that doesnt annoy.

Well intentioned, but a bit all over the place. She speaks beautifully, but often uses vocabulary and diction beyond anyone who hasn't been taking Spanish for 6 or 7 years. PLENTY of busy work, Spanish Club attendance requirements, and inconsistency make her a no-go, though honestly she could be much worse.
Needs to be better focused; rather than teaching Spanish, a good deal of time was devoted to disturbing Spanish art and inappropriate YouTube music videos.

Nice teacher but seemed confused some of the time.  She would tell us more than once that we were having a quiz, than forget about it--then give it next class.  Her Spanish is beautiful though  & I like her.  Area for improvement--more structure/passion for teaching.  Easy A is not the issue--not sure why so many want an easy grade.
Great teacher. She is very helpful if you ask questions and she makes class fun. She's interesting and doesn't just lecture. Just like all the Spanish classes you can only have 2 absences.

Provides a syllabus at the beginning that explains ALL of the major assignments. Go to class and do all of the homework. Its a language course so you need to be in every class and spend time practicing at home to really grasp the language. Her explanations are thorough and she is an easy grader. The tests were surprisingly easier than expected.

Not too hard of a class. I was lost after taking a year off from spanish classes though, she just tosses you right in there. She is very nice and helpful. If you have questions about the assignments or the language she will help you everytime. Don't forget your book though, class revolves around that. Attend class. And do the online assignments!

Great class. She is a native speaker and talks to us a lot in spanish which is helpful to learning.  She does follow the department's syllabus, with due dates a day or two behind.  She is encouraging and fun, but she could be clearer on due dates.
Nice lady but not the best teacher. Not very clear about standards or expectations.
Very nice and easy. Show up, do your work, and you will be fine. Most of the classes are just talking about different subjects in spanish.
Good teacher. lots of busy work but it's pretty easy
